content.title: Brachial Artery Access
content.description: Upper extremity arterial access via the brachial artery, used when femoral access is not possible or for interventions requiring antegrade aortic approach.
indications: Severe aortoiliac disease preventing femoral access
Combined upper and lower extremity procedures

anatomy.location: Antecubital fossa, medial to biceps tendon

technique.sheath_size: Usually limited to 5-6Fr due to vessel size

complications.thrombosis: Higher risk in small caliber vessels
